conclusion: Determine the time it takes for the detector to move from point A to point B given that its velocity is inversely proportional to its displacement.
Velocity v is inversely proportional to displacement x, so v = k/x where k is a constant.
Velocities at points A and B are 4 m/s and 2 m/s respectively, and displacement from O to B is 2 m.
Find displacement at point A: x_A = 1 m.
Calculate time t to move from A to B using integration: t = âˆ«(1 to 2) (x/4) dx.
Evaluate the integral to find t = 0.375 s.
The time it takes for the detector to move from point A to point B is 0.375 seconds.
